summary: WHILE DRIVING AT 10 MPH ON TRAFFIC ENTERING THE UNIVERSITY THE STEERING GRADUALLY BECAME STIFFER, UNTIL THE ENGINE SUDDENLY TURNOFF BY ITSELF, LOOSING ALL THE CONTROLS OF THE CAR. NO SENSORS OR SAFETY LIGHTS WENT ON AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.  AFTER A FEW MINUTES I TURNED THAT CAR BACK ON AND EVERYTHING WAS IN WORKING ORDER.  I CALLED THE ROAD ASSISTANCE AND INFORMED THE DEALER SINCE THE CAR WAS SERVICED BACK ON FEBRUARY 23, 2017 DUE TO A SAFETY RECALL NOTICE S89 - CRANKSHAFT CAMSHAFT SENSOR, AT A HIGHER SPEED THIS INCIDENT COULD HAVE RESULTED IN A MAYOR COLLISION. THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT OF  BENITEZ CHRYSLER IS EVALUATING THE CAUSE.  SO FAR THE  DIAGNOSTICS INDICATE A STOP LAND SWITCH FAILURE AT THE BREAK. I INDICATED THAT THEY HAVE TO CALL CHRYSLER AND ODI-NHTSA IN ORDER TO REPORT THE INCIDENT AND LOOK FOR GUIDANCE, SINCE I WILL NOT EXPOSE ANY LIFE ON A NEW CAR UNRESOLVED SAFETY PROBLEM.
